intro: Erysimum spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of broad, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its showy blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
